  • View page source

Installing OfficeLink¶

The Microsoft Office COM Add-In on the client side is installed via the provided MSI installation package, which contains all necessary files. After the installation of the cs.officelink-package the MSI installation packages, each specifically marked for language and Office version, are ready to be downloaded on the Installation Packages web page of the system.

The installation program copies all associated files into a selected installation directory and configures the necessary registration entries.

A already installed Microsoft Office-Integration will be replaced automatically. This is independent of the installed version number, whether its newer or older.

Important

The supported Microsoft Office applications must be closed during installation.

Note

If the ‘typical’ method is selected during the installation procedure, OfficeLink is installed neither for Microsoft Outlook nor Microsoft Project.

For an adapted installation in batch mode, MSIEXEC has to be called up with the parameter ADDLOCAL=”[component names separated by comma]”, whereby the respective component names must be taken from the table located below.

List of OfficeLink application options¶
  Excel Outlook

PowerPoint

 Project Visio Word

Typical installation component

 X   X   X X

Internal component name

 FeatExcel FeatOutlook FeatPowerPoint FeatProject FeatVisio FeatWord

Here is an example that would run a complete installation:

MSIEXEC /quiet /i OfficeLink_15.5.0.0_OFFICEx64_en-us.msi ADDLOCAL="FeatExcel,
FeatOutlook,FeatPowerPoint,FeatProject,FeatVisio,FeatWord"

Under certain circumstances, OfficeLink may be marked by an Microsoft Office application at runtime as Disabled Item and will no longer be loaded in the following. This can also happen under external fault by e.g. other Microsoft Office add-ins. OfficeLink can then be reactivated from the options menu of the respective application. In the tab Add-Ins there is a combo box, via which you can access the dialog guilabel:Disabled Items. Afterwards OfficeLink must be additionally reactivated in the dialog COM-Add-Ins, which can be accessed via the same combo box.

Administratively, removal from the Disabled Items can be configured, e.g. via a group policy, which reactivates all disabled items for Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project, Visio and Word 2010 by deleting the following sample registry keys:

HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\14.0\Excel\Resiliency\DisabledItems
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\14.0\Outlook\Resiliency\DisabledItems
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\14.0\PowerPoint\Resiliency\DisabledItems
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\14.0\Project\Resiliency\DisabledItems
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\14.0\Word\Resiliency\DisabledItems
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\14.0\Visio\Resiliency\DisabledItems
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\Excel\Addins\OfficeLink.Connect
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\MS Project\Addins\OfficeLink.Connect
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\OfficeLink.Connect
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\PowerPoint\Addins\OfficeLink.Connect
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\Word\Addins\OfficeLink.Connect
HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Visio\Addins\OfficeLink.Connect
